013package org.apache.juneau.json;

015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;

019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.nio.charset.*;
021import java.util.*;
022import java.util.function.*;
023
024import org.apache.juneau.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;

031/**
032 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link JsonParser}.
033 *
034 * <ul class='notes'>
035 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe and is typically discarded after one use.
036 * </ul>
037 *
038 * <ul class='seealso'>
039 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.JsonDetails">JSON Details</a>
040
041 * </ul>
042 */
043@SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
044public final class JsonParserSession extends ReaderParserSession {
045
046   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
047   // Static
048   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
049
050   private static final AsciiSet decChars = AsciiSet.create().ranges("0-9").build();
051
052   /**
053    * Creates a new builder for this object.
054    *
055    * @param ctx The context creating this session.
056    * @return A new builder.
057    */
058   public static Builder create(JsonParser ctx) {
059      return new Builder(ctx);
060   }
061
062   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
063   // Builder
064   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
065
066   /**
067    * Builder class.
068    */
069   @FluentSetters
070   public static class Builder extends ReaderParserSession.Builder {
071
072      JsonParser ctx;
073
074      /**
075       * Constructor
076       *
077       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
078       */
079      protected Builder(JsonParser ctx) {
080         super(ctx);
081         this.ctx = ctx;
082      }
083
084      @Override
085      public JsonParserSession build() {
086         return new JsonParserSession(this);
087      }
088
089      // <FluentSetters>
090
091      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
092      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
093         super.apply(type, apply);
094         return this;
095      }
096

099         super.debug(value);
100         return this;
101      }

105         super.properties(value);
106         return this;
107      }

112         return this;
113      }

117         super.unmodifiable();
118         return this;
119      }

123         super.locale(value);
124         return this;

141         super.mediaTypeDefault(value);

165         super.outer(value);

196   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
197   // Instance
198   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
199
200   private final JsonParser ctx;
201
202   /**
203    * Constructor.
204    *
205    * @param builder The builder for this object.
206    */
207   protected JsonParserSession(Builder builder) {
208      super(builder);
209      ctx = builder.ctx;
210   }
211
212   /**
213    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace.
214    *
215    * <p>
216    * The definition of whitespace is different for strict vs lax mode.
217    * Strict mode only interprets 0x20 (space), 0x09 (tab), 0x0A (line feed) and 0x0D (carriage return) as whitespace.
218    * Lax mode uses {@link Character#isWhitespace(int)} to make the determination.
219    *
220    * @param cp The codepoint.
221    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace.
222    */
223   protected final boolean isWhitespace(int cp) {
224      if (isStrict())
225            return cp <= 0x20 && (cp == 0x09 || cp == 0x0A || cp == 0x0D || cp == 0x20);
226      return Character.isWhitespace(cp);
227   }
228
229   /**
230    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
231    *
232    * @param cp The codepoint.
233    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
234    */
235   protected final boolean isCommentOrWhitespace(int cp) {
236      if (cp == '/')
237         return true;
238      if (isStrict())
239         return cp <= 0x20 && (cp == 0x09 || cp == 0x0A || cp == 0x0D || cp == 0x20);
240      return Character.isWhitespace(cp);
241   }
242
243   @Override /* ParserSession */
244   protected <T> T doParse(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
245      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
246         if (r == null)
247            return null;
248         T o = parseAnything(type, r, getOuter(), null);
249         validateEnd(r);
250         return o;
251      }
252   }
253
254   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
255   protected <K,V> Map<K,V> doParseIntoMap(ParserPipe pipe, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
256      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
257         m = parseIntoMap2(r, m, (ClassMeta<K>)getClassMeta(keyType), (ClassMeta<V>)getClassMeta(valueType), null);
258         validateEnd(r);
259         return m;
260      }
261   }
262
263   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
264   protected <E> Collection<E> doParseIntoCollection(ParserPipe pipe, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
265      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
266         c = parseIntoCollection2(r, c, getClassMeta(elementType), null);
267         validateEnd(r);
268         return c;
269      }
270   }
271
272   private <T> T parseAnything(ClassMeta<?> eType, ParserReader r, Object outer, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
273
274      if (eType == null)
275         eType = object();
276      ObjectSwap<T,Object> swap = (ObjectSwap<T,Object>)eType.getSwap(this);
277      BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)eType.getBuilderSwap(this);
278      ClassMeta<?> sType = null;
279      if (builder != null)
280         sType = builder.getBuilderClassMeta(this);
281      else if (swap != null)
282         sType = swap.getSwapClassMeta(this);
283      else
284         sType = eType;
285
286      if (sType.isOptional())
287         return (T)optional(parseAnything(eType.getElementType(), r, outer, pMeta));
288
289      setCurrentClass(sType);
290      String wrapperAttr = getJsonClassMeta(sType).getWrapperAttr();
291
292      Object o = null;
293
294      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
295      if (wrapperAttr != null)
296         skipWrapperAttrStart(r, wrapperAttr);
297      int c = r.peek();
298      if (c == -1) {
299         if (isStrict())
300            throw new ParseException(this, "Empty input.");
301         // Let o be null.
302      } else if ((c == ',' || c == '}' || c == ']')) {
303         if (isStrict())
304            throw new ParseException(this, "Missing value detected.");
305         // Handle bug in Cognos 10.2.1 that can product non-existent values.
306         // Let o be null;
307      } else if (c == 'n') {
308         parseKeyword("null", r);
309      } else if (sType.isObject()) {
310         if (c == '{') {
311            JsonMap m2 = new JsonMap(this);
312            parseIntoMap2(r, m2, string(), object(), pMeta);
313            o = cast(m2, pMeta, eType);
314         } else if (c == '[') {
315            o = parseIntoCollection2(r, new JsonList(this), object(), pMeta);
316         } else if (c == '\'' || c == '"') {
317            o = parseString(r);
318            if (sType.isChar())
319               o = parseCharacter(o);
320         } else if (c >= '0' && c <= '9' || c == '-' || c == '.') {
321            o = parseNumber(r, null);
322         } else if (c == 't') {
323            parseKeyword("true", r);
324            o = Boolean.TRUE;
325         } else {
326            parseKeyword("false", r);
327            o = Boolean.FALSE;
328         }
329      } else if (sType.isBoolean()) {
330         o = parseBoolean(r);
331      } else if (sType.isCharSequence()) {
332         o = parseString(r);
333      } else if (sType.isChar()) {
334         o = parseCharacter(parseString(r));
335      } else if (sType.isNumber()) {
336         o = parseNumber(r, (Class<? extends Number>)sType.getInnerClass());
337      } else if (sType.isMap()) {
338         Map m = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)sType.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(sType));
339         o = parseIntoMap2(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
340      } else if (sType.isCollection()) {
341         if (c == '{') {
342            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
343            parseIntoMap2(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
344            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
345         } else {
346            Collection l = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Collection)sType.newInstance() : new JsonList(this));
347            o = parseIntoCollection2(r, l, sType, pMeta);
348         }
349      } else if (builder != null) {
350         BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, eType));
351         o = builder.build(this, parseIntoBeanMap2(r, m).getBean(), eType);
352      } else if (sType.canCreateNewBean(outer)) {
353         BeanMap m = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass());
354         o = parseIntoBeanMap2(r, m).getBean();
355      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer) && (c == '\'' || c == '"')) {
356         o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, parseString(r));
357      } else if (sType.isArray() || sType.isArgs()) {
358         if (c == '{') {
359            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
360            parseIntoMap2(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
361            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
362         } else {
363            ArrayList l = (ArrayList)parseIntoCollection2(r, list(), sType, pMeta);
364            o = toArray(sType, l);
365         }
366      } else if (c == '{') {
367         Map m = new JsonMap(this);
368         parseIntoMap2(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
369         if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(eType)))
370            o = cast((JsonMap)m, pMeta, eType);
371         else if (sType.getProxyInvocationHandler() != null)
372            o = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass()).load(m).getBean();
373         else
374            throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
375                  sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
376      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer) && ! isStrict()) {
377         o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, parseString(r));
378      } else {
379         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax for class type ''{0}'', starting character ''{1}''",
380            sType, (char)c);
381      }
382
383      if (wrapperAttr != null)
384         skipWrapperAttrEnd(r);
385
386      if (swap != null && o != null)
387         o = unswap(swap, o, eType);
388
389      if (outer != null)
390         setParent(eType, o, outer);
391
392      return (T)o;
393   }
394
395   private Number parseNumber(ParserReader r, Class<? extends Number> type) throws IOException, ParseException {
396      int c = r.peek();
397      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
398         return parseNumber(r, parseString(r), type);
399      return parseNumber(r, r.parseNumberString(), type);
400   }
401
402   private Number parseNumber(ParserReader r, String s, Class<? extends Number> type) throws ParseException {
403
404      // JSON has slightly different number rules from Java.
405      // Strict mode enforces these different rules, lax does not.
406      if (isStrict()) {
407
408         // Lax allows blank strings to represent 0.
409         // Strict does not allow blank strings.
410         if (s.length() == 0)
411            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
412
413         // Need to weed out octal and hexadecimal formats:  0123,-0123,0x123,-0x123.
414         // Don't weed out 0 or -0.
415         boolean isNegative = false;
416         char c = s.charAt(0);
417         if (c == '-') {
418            isNegative = true;
419            c = (s.length() == 1 ? 'x' : s.charAt(1));
420         }
421
422         // JSON doesn't allow '.123' and '-.123'.
423         if (c == '.')
424            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
425
426         // '01' is not a valid number, but '0.1', '0e1', '0e+1' are valid.
427         if (c == '0' && s.length() > (isNegative ? 2 : 1)) {
428            char c2 = s.charAt((isNegative ? 2 : 1));
429            if (c2 != '.' && c2 != 'e' && c2 != 'E')
430               throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
431         }
432
433         // JSON doesn't allow '1.' or '0.e1'.
434         int i = s.indexOf('.');
435         if (i != -1 && (s.length() == (i+1) || ! decChars.contains(s.charAt(i+1))))
436            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
437
438      }
439      return StringUtils.parseNumber(s, type);
440   }
441
442   private Boolean parseBoolean(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
443      int c = r.peek();
444      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
445         return Boolean.valueOf(parseString(r));
446      if (c == 't') {
447         parseKeyword("true", r);
448         return Boolean.TRUE;
449      } else if (c == 'f') {
450         parseKeyword("false", r);
451         return Boolean.FALSE;
452      } else {
453         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected boolean value, actual=''{0}''", r.read(100));
454      }
455   }
456
457   private <K,V> Map<K,V> parseIntoMap2(ParserReader r, Map<K,V> m, ClassMeta<K> keyType,
458         ClassMeta<V> valueType, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
459
460      if (keyType == null)
461         keyType = (ClassMeta<K>)string();
462
463      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
464      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
465      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
466      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
467      int S5=5; // Looking for , or }
468      int S6=6; // Found , looking for attr start.
469
470      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
471      int state = S0;
472      String currAttr = null;
473      int c = 0;
474      while (c != -1) {
475         c = r.read();
476         if (state == S0) {
477            if (c == '{')
478               state = S1;
479            else
480               break;
481         } else if (state == S1) {
482            if (c == '}') {
483               return m;
484            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
485               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
486            } else {
487               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
488               state = S3;
489            }
490         } else if (state == S3) {
491            if (c == ':')
492               state = S4;
493         } else if (state == S4) {
494            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
495               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
496            } else {
497               K key = convertAttrToType(m, currAttr, keyType);
498               V value = parseAnything(valueType, r.unread(), m, pMeta);
499               setName(valueType, value, key);
500               m.put(key, value);
501               state = S5;
502            }
503         } else if (state == S5) {
504            if (c == ',') {
505               state = S6;
506            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
507               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
508            } else if (c == '}') {
509               return m;
510            } else {
511               break;
512            }
513         } else if (state == S6) {
514            if (c == '}') {
515               break;
516            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
517               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
518            } else {
519               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
520               state = S3;
521            }
522         }
523      }
524      if (state == S0)
525         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
526      if (state == S1)
527         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
528      if (state == S3)
529         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
530      if (state == S4)
531         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
532      if (state == S5)
533         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' marking end of JSON object.");
534      if (state == S6)
535         throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected '}' found in JSON object.");
536
537      return null; // Unreachable.
538   }
539
540   /*
541    * Parse a JSON attribute from the character array at the specified position, then
542    * set the position marker to the last character in the field name.
543    */
544   private String parseFieldName(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
545      int c = r.peek();
546      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
547         return parseString(r);
548      if (isStrict())
549         throw new ParseException(this, "Unquoted attribute detected.");
550      if (! VALID_BARE_CHARS.contains(c))
551         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find the start of the field name.");
552      r.mark();
553      // Look for whitespace.
554      while (c != -1) {
555         c = r.read();
556         if (! VALID_BARE_CHARS.contains(c)) {
557            r.unread();
558            String s = r.getMarked().intern();
559            return s.equals("null") ? null : s;
560         }
561      }
562      throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find the end of the field name.");
563   }
564
565   private static final AsciiSet VALID_BARE_CHARS = AsciiSet.create().range('A','Z').range('a','z').range('0','9').chars("$_-.").build();
566
567   private <E> Collection<E> parseIntoCollection2(ParserReader r, Collection<E> l,
568         ClassMeta<?> type, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
569
570      int S0=0; // Looking for outermost [
571      int S1=1; // Looking for starting [ or { or " or ' or LITERAL or ]
572      int S2=2; // Looking for , or ]
573      int S3=3; // Looking for starting [ or { or " or ' or LITERAL
574
575      int argIndex = 0;
576
577      int state = S0;
578      int c = 0;
579      while (c != -1) {
580         c = r.read();
581         if (state == S0) {
582            if (c == '[')
583               state = S1;
584            else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c))
585               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
586            else
587               break;  // Invalid character found.
588         } else if (state == S1) {
589            if (c == ']') {
590               return l;
591            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
592               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
593            } else if (c != -1) {
594               l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(), r.unread(), l, pMeta));
595               state = S2;
596            }
597         } else if (state == S2) {
598            if (c == ',') {
599               state = S3;
600            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
601               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
602            } else if (c == ']') {
603               return l;
604            } else {
605               break;  // Invalid character found.
606            }
607         } else if (state == S3) {
608            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
609               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
610            } else if (c == ']') {
611               break;
612            } else if (c != -1) {
613               l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(), r.unread(), l, pMeta));
614               state = S2;
615            }
616         }
617      }
618      if (state == S0)
619         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '[' at beginning of JSON array.");
620      if (state == S1)
621         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
622      if (state == S2)
623         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected ',' or ']'.");
624      if (state == S3)
625         throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected trailing comma in array.");
626
627      return null;  // Unreachable.
628   }
629
630   private <T> BeanMap<T> parseIntoBeanMap2(ParserReader r, BeanMap<T> m) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
631
632      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
633      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
634      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
635      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
636      int S5=5; // Looking for , or }
637
638      int state = S0;
639      String currAttr = "";
640      int c = 0;
641      mark();
642      try {
643         while (c != -1) {
644            c = r.read();
645            if (state == S0) {
646               if (c == '{') {
647                  state = S1;
648               } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
649                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
650               } else {
651                  break;
652               }
653            } else if (state == S1) {
654               if (c == '}') {
655                  return m;
656               } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
657                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
658               } else {
659                  r.unread();
660                  mark();
661                  currAttr = parseFieldName(r);
662                  state = S3;
663               }
664            } else if (state == S3) {
665               if (c == ':')
666                  state = S4;
667            } else if (state == S4) {
668               if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
669                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
670               } else {
671                  if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
672                     BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
673                     setCurrentProperty(pMeta);
674                     if (pMeta == null) {
675                        onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, parseAnything(object(), r.unread(), m.getBean(false), null));
676                        unmark();
677                     } else {
678                        unmark();
679                        ClassMeta<?> cm = pMeta.getClassMeta();
680                        Object value = parseAnything(cm, r.unread(), m.getBean(false), pMeta);
681                        setName(cm, value, currAttr);
682                        try {
683                           pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
684                        } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
685                           onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
686                           throw e;
687                        }
688                     }
689                     setCurrentProperty(null);
690                  }
691                  state = S5;
692               }
693            } else if (state == S5) {
694               if (c == ',')
695                  state = S1;
696               else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c))
697                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
698               else if (c == '}') {
699                  return m;
700               }
701            }
702         }
703         if (state == S0)
704            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
705         if (state == S1)
706            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
707         if (state == S3)
708            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
709         if (state == S4)
710            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
711         if (state == S5)
712            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' marking end of JSON object.");
713      } finally {
714         unmark();
715      }
716
717      return null; // Unreachable.
718   }
719
720   /*
721    * Starting from the specified position in the character array, returns the
722    * position of the character " or '.
723    * If the string consists of a concatenation of strings (e.g. 'AAA' + "BBB"), this method
724    * will automatically concatenate the strings and return the result.
725    */
726   private String parseString(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
727      r.mark();
728      int qc = r.read();      // The quote character being used (" or ')
729      if (qc != '"' && isStrict()) {
730         String msg = (
731            qc == '\''
732            ? "Invalid quote character \"{0}\" being used."
733            : "Did not find quote character marking beginning of string.  Character=\"{0}\""
734         );
735         throw new ParseException(this, msg, (char)qc);
736      }
737      final boolean isQuoted = (qc == '\'' || qc == '"');
738      String s = null;
739      boolean isInEscape = false;
740      int c = 0;
741      while (c != -1) {
742         c = r.read();
743         // Strict syntax requires that all control characters be escaped.
744         if (isStrict() && c <= 0x1F)
745            throw new ParseException(this, "Unescaped control character encountered: ''0x{0}''", String.format("%04X", c));
746         if (isInEscape) {
747            switch (c) {
748               case 'n': r.replace('\n'); break;
749               case 'r': r.replace('\r'); break;
750               case 't': r.replace('\t'); break;
751               case 'f': r.replace('\f'); break;
752               case 'b': r.replace('\b'); break;
753               case '\\': r.replace('\\'); break;
754               case '/': r.replace('/'); break;
755               case '\'': r.replace('\''); break;
756               case '"': r.replace('"'); break;
757               case 'u': {
758                  String n = r.read(4);
759                  try {
760                     r.replace(Integer.parseInt(n, 16), 6);
761                  } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
762                     throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid Unicode escape sequence in string.");
763                  }
764                  break;
765               }
766               default:
767                  throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid escape sequence in string.");
768            }
769            isInEscape = false;
770         } else {
771            if (c == '\\') {
772               isInEscape = true;
773               r.delete();
774            } else if (isQuoted) {
775               if (c == qc) {
776                  s = r.getMarked(1, -1);
777                  break;
778               }
779            } else {
780               if (c == ',' || c == '}' || c == ']' || isWhitespace(c)) {
781                  s = r.getMarked(0, -1);
782                  r.unread();
783                  break;
784               } else if (c == -1) {
785                  s = r.getMarked(0, 0);
786                  break;
787               }
788            }
789         }
790      }
791      if (s == null)
792         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find expected end character ''{0}''.", (char)qc);
793
794      // Look for concatenated string (i.e. whitespace followed by +).
795      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
796      if (r.peek() == '+') {
797         if (isStrict())
798            throw new ParseException(this, "String concatenation detected.");
799         r.read();   // Skip past '+'
800         skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
801         s += parseString(r);
802      }
803      return trim(s); // End of input reached.
804   }
805
806   /*
807    * Looks for the keywords true, false, or null.
808    * Throws an exception if any of these keywords are not found at the specified position.
809    */
810   private void parseKeyword(String keyword, ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
811      try {
812         String s = r.read(keyword.length());
813         if (s.equals(keyword))
814            return;
815         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected=''{0}'', Actual=''{1}''", keyword, s);
816      } catch (IndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
817         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected=''{0}'', found end-of-file.", keyword);
818      }
819   }
820
821   /*
822    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond any whitespace or comments.
823    * If positionOnNext is 'true', then the cursor will be set to the point immediately after
824    * the comments and whitespace.  Otherwise, the cursor will be set to the last position of
825    * the comments and whitespace.
826    */
827   private void skipCommentsAndSpace(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
828      int c = 0;
829      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
830         if (! isWhitespace(c)) {
831            if (c == '/') {
832               if (isStrict())
833                  throw new ParseException(this, "Javascript comment detected.");
834               skipComments(r);
835            } else {
836               r.unread();
837               return;
838            }
839         }
840      }
841   }
842
843   /*
844    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond the construct "{wrapperAttr:" when
845    * the @Json(wrapperAttr) annotation is used on a class.
846    */
847   private void skipWrapperAttrStart(ParserReader r, String wrapperAttr) throws IOException, ParseException {
848
849      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
850      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
851      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
852      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
853
854      int state = S0;
855      String currAttr = null;
856      int c = 0;
857      while (c != -1) {
858         c = r.read();
859         if (state == S0) {
860            if (c == '{')
861               state = S1;
862         } else if (state == S1) {
863            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
864               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
865            } else {
866               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
867               if (! currAttr.equals(wrapperAttr))
868                  throw new ParseException(this,
869                     "Expected to find wrapper attribute ''{0}'' but found attribute ''{1}''", wrapperAttr, currAttr);
870               state = S3;
871            }
872         } else if (state == S3) {
873            if (c == ':')
874               state = S4;
875         } else if (state == S4) {
876            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
877               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
878            } else {
879               r.unread();
880               return;
881            }
882         }
883      }
884      if (state == S0)
885         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
886      if (state == S1)
887         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
888      if (state == S3)
889         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
890      if (state == S4)
891         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
892   }
893
894   /*
895    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond the construct "}" when
896    * the @Json(wrapperAttr) annotation is used on a class.
897    */
898   private void skipWrapperAttrEnd(ParserReader r) throws ParseException, IOException {
899      int c = 0;
900      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
901         if (! isWhitespace(c)) {
902            if (c == '/') {
903               if (isStrict())
904                  throw new ParseException(this, "Javascript comment detected.");
905               skipComments(r);
906            } else if (c == '}') {
907               return;
908            } else {
909               throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' at the end of JSON wrapper object.");
910            }
911         }
912      }
913   }
914
915   /*
916    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but when positioned at the beginning of comment,
917    * it will move the pointer to the last character in the comment.
918    */
919   private void skipComments(ParserReader r) throws ParseException, IOException {
920      int c = r.read();
921      //  "/* */" style comments
922      if (c == '*') {
923         while (c != -1)
924            if ((c = r.read()) == '*')
925               if ((c = r.read()) == '/')
926                  return;
927      //  "//" style comments
928      } else if (c == '/') {
929         while (c != -1) {
930            c = r.read();
931            if (c == -1 || c == '\n')
932               return;
933         }
934      }
935      throw new ParseException(this, "Open ended comment.");
936   }
937
938   /*
939    * Call this method after you've finished a parsing a string to make sure that if there's any
940    * remainder in the input, that it consists only of whitespace and comments.
941    */
942   private void validateEnd(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
943      if (! isValidateEnd())
944         return;
945      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
946      int c = r.read();
947      if (c != -1 && c != ';')  // var x = {...}; expressions can end with a semicolon.
948         throw new ParseException(this, "Remainder after parse: ''{0}''.", (char)c);
949   }
950
951   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
952   // Properties
953   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
954
955   /**
956    * Validate end.
957    *
958    * @see JsonParser.Builder#validateEnd()
959    * @return
960    *    <jk>true</jk> if after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
961    *    the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
962    */
963   protected final boolean isValidateEnd() {
964      return ctx.isValidateEnd();
965   }
966
967   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
968   // Extended metadata
969   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
970
971   /**
972    * Returns the language-specific metadata on the specified class.
973    *
974    * @param cm The class to return the metadata on.
975    * @return The metadata.
976    */
977   protected JsonClassMeta getJsonClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
978      return ctx.getJsonClassMeta(cm);
979   }
980}
